meanings.definition: To sail or travel all the way around (something, especially the world)
meanings.sent1: The ship circumnavigates the globe, exploring different countries.
meanings.sent2: He plans to circumnavigate the lake to reach the other side.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat circumnavigates the backyard, searching for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind circumnavigates the idea of traveling to distant lands.
meanings.sent5: The satellite circumnavigates the Earth, capturing stunning images from space.

meanings.definition: To go around or bypass (something) by sailing or traveling in a circle
meanings.sent1: The hiker decided to circumnavigate the mountain to avoid the rough terrain.
meanings.sent2: The airplane had to circumnavigate the storm to reach its destination safely.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel circumnavigates the tree to outsmart the persistent bird.
meanings.sent4: His argument skillfully circumnavigates the main issue at hand.
meanings.sent5: The river circumnavigates the city, providing a scenic route for boat tours.
